data.text: Be still, ye inhabitants of the isle;
And by great waters the seed of Sihor,
Be thou ashamed, O Zidon: for the sea hath spoken,
As at the report concerning Egypt,
Pass ye over to Tarshish; howl, ye inhabitants of the isle.
Is this your joyous city, whose antiquity is of ancient days?
Who hath taken this counsel against Tyre, the crowning city,
The Lord of hosts hath purposed it,
Pass through thy land as a river, O daughter of Tarshish:
He stretched out his hand over the sea, he shook the kingdoms:
And he said, Thou shalt no more rejoice,
Behold the land of the Chaldeans;
Howl, ye ships of Tarshish: for your strength is laid waste.
And it shall come to pass in that day,
Take a harp, go about the city, thou harlot that hast been forgotten;
And it shall come to pass after the end of seventy years,
And her merchandise and her hire shall be holiness to the Lord:
